verses.text: The LORD’s word that came to Joel, the son of Pethuel.
Hear this, you elders,
Tell your children about it,
What the swarming locust has left, the great locust has eaten.
Wake up, you drunkards, and weep!
For a nation has come up on my land, strong, and without number.
He has laid my vine waste,
Mourn like a virgin dressed in sackcloth
The meal offering and the drink offering are cut off from the LORD’s house.
The field is laid waste.
Be confounded, you farmers!
The vine has dried up, and the fig tree withered—
Put on sackcloth and mourn, you priests!
Sanctify a fast.
Alas for the day!
Isn’t the food cut off before our eyes,
The seeds rot under their clods.
How the animals groan!
LORD, I cry to you,
Yes, the animals of the field pant to you,
Blow the trumpet in Zion,
A day of darkness and gloominess,
A fire devours before them,
Their appearance is as the appearance of horses,
Like the noise of chariots on the tops of the mountains, they leap,
At their presence the peoples are in anguish.
They run like mighty men.
One doesn’t jostle another.
They rush on the city.
The earth quakes before them.
The LORD thunders his voice before his army,
“Yet even now,” says the LORD, “turn to me with all your heart,
Tear your heart and not your garments,
Who knows? He may turn and relent,
Blow the trumpet in Zion!
Gather the people.
Let the priests, the ministers of the LORD, weep between the porch and the altar,
Then the LORD was jealous for his land,
The LORD answered his people,
But I will remove the northern army far away from you,
Land, don’t be afraid.
Don’t be afraid, you animals of the field;
“Be glad then, you children of Zion,
The threshing floors will be full of wheat,
I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten,
You will have plenty to eat and be satisfied,
You will know that I am amongst Israel,
“It will happen afterward, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh;
And also on the servants and on the handmaids in those days,
I will show wonders in the heavens and in the earth:
The sun will be turned into darkness,
It will happen that whoever will call on the LORD’s name shall be saved;
“For, behold, in those days,
I will gather all nations,
and have cast lots for my people,
“Yes, and what are you to me, Tyre and Sidon,
Because you have taken my silver and my gold,
and have sold the children of Judah and the children of Jerusalem to the sons of the Greeks,
Behold, I will stir them up out of the place where you have sold them,
and I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hands of the children of Judah,
Proclaim this amongst the nations:
Beat your ploughshares into swords,
Hurry and come, all you surrounding nations,
“Let the nations arouse themselves,
Put in the sickle;
Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision!
The sun and the moon are darkened,
The LORD will roar from Zion,
“So you will know that I am the LORD, your God,
It will happen in that day,
Egypt will be a desolation
But Judah will be inhabited forever,
I will cleanse their blood
